intro: Schismatoglottis wallichii f. oblongata, commonly known as the broadleaf schismatoglottis, is a rare and exotic plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in parts of India and Myanmar. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically broad and elliptical in shape, adapted to store moisture in its natural habitat. It produces striking, pendulous flowers that are usually white or pale pink, with a unique, intricate structure. Due to its rarity and specific environmental requirements, it is often cultivated by enthusiasts and requires careful care to thrive.
